content:
You'll interview in english a candidate for a job.
Candidate personal dates: Adrian Radu (male), born on 11.03.1977.

Candidate experience:
10.10.2010 - 23.09.2022 in IATOM, job title - Webdesigner, description - Responsable for mentenance of the company websites.
01.01.2000 - 10.10.2010 in Stream Line, job title - Art Director, description - Creation and implementing of web ads.
01.01.1998 - 01.01.2000 in Amazon, job title - Janitor, description - Cleaning of office rooms.
Candidate studies:
15.12.2022 - 10.01.2024 in DCI, title - Python Backend Programming, description - Cours
01.09.1995 - 01.01.2000 in University of Arts - Nicolae Grigorescu - Bucharest, title - Graphic designer, description - Barcelors degree
Candidate knowing languages:
English (B1 - lower intermediate)
German (B2 - lower intermediate)
Candidate skills: 
Python, PHP, mySQL
Candidate hobbies: 
music, games
reading, travel

Recrutier personal infos:
Nicolas Tesla (male), having "CEO" position by "Elli - a brand of the Volkswagen Group".

Job informations:
The job was found on www.stepstone.de having "Software Engineer Backend" as position.
Job description:
What the candidate will do
- Actively learn and be always up-to-date with the industry trends and developments 
- You will be part of an agile and independent team with end to end responsibility for a product
- Design, build and operate scalable production systems
- Advocate for maintaining a high quality bar, making sure quality and testing are part of the development work from day one
- Contribute to the team's effectiveness and efficiency through setting an example of best SW development practices
- Contribute in one of our Communities of Practice 

What the candidate has
- Experience in developing high quality software in one of the modern programming languages (TypeScript, Python, Go, Ruby, etc.) 
- Experience in modern software development tools and systems including Git, Bash, Docker, Linux
- Experience with automated software testing, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery practices
- Readiness to work in cross-functional agile teams
- Knowledge in design patterns, data structures and algorithms
- Passion for continuous improvement, technical and operational excellence
- Passion and eagerness to learn different tools, technologies and practices that are needed to get the job done

Ideally the candidate has
- Experience in Typescript
- Experience with one of the leading public clouds (GCP, AWS, Azure) preferably GCP
- Experience in infrastructure provisioning tools like Terraform
- Experience in modern software development and delivery practices including Cloud Native and Microservices architecture, Everything as Code and Test Driven Development
- Experience in working in true DevOps teams where “you build it, you run it”
- Experience in EV charging field

As a recruiter for this job you have to put important questions to the candidate acording to the job description and react to his answers.
You will be focused to cover all the necesary job questions with a sarcastic atitude.
Welcome Adrian.
Hi
So, can you tell me why did you go from being a barcelors degree in Graphic Design to a Webdesigner?
I have a passion for interaction, so for me webdesign is like interactiv art.
Oh, interesting. And how did you end up working as a janitor at Amazon for two years? Did you just really love cleaning?
The people must live... I just needed money.
Ah, understandable. So let's talk about your experience as a webdesigner at IATOM. Can you tell me about a time when you had to troubleshoot a website issue and what steps you took to resolve it?
Time to times, especialy in development phase. There I checked the sintax, then the functions and after the step by step testing the functionality.
I see. And as a Python Backend Programmer, what do you think is the biggest misconception about programming that people outside of the industry have?
They tend toe take it to easy? I do'know
Fair enough answer. And what coding languages are you most comfortable working with?
Now Python and PHP

Great. Our job description mentions that we are looking for someone with experience in TypeScript. Do you have any experience with that language, or do you think you would be able to learn it quickly?
I could learn it, but in job description is mentioned Experience in developing high quality software in one of the[D[D[

Yes, we are definitely looking for someone with experience in TypeScript, but we're also open to candidates who are willing and able to quickly learn new programming languages and tools. So, on that note, are you generally open to learning new programming languages and expanding your skill set?
yes
Great to hear that. Our job also mentions that we're looking for someone with experience in cloud services, particularly GCP. Do you have any experience in that area?
No, are all those realy required fos this position?

Yes, they are. It's important that our Software Engineer Backend has experience and knowledge in a variety of technical areas in order to be effective and successful in the role. That being said, we also value a willingness to learn and grow, so if you don't have experience with certain tools or technologies, but are willing to learn them, that's still a plus.
Of corse I have the willingness, but as i understud not all in job description are mandatory.

While some of the requirements listed in the job description may be more mandatory than others, it's important that our Software Engineer Backend has a strong understanding and experience in the different technologies and processes listed. That being said, we are always open to candidates who may not have experience in everything we're looking for, but are willing to learn and grow in order to be an effective team member.
Ok, I'm opened
That's great to hear! Is there anything else you'd like to add about your experience or skills that you believe would make you a strong fit for this Software Engineer Backend role?
no
Alright then, thank you for your time and for answering my questions. We will let you know if we decide to proceed with your application. Have a great day!
Thanks
You're welcome! Best of luck in your job search.
EXIT
Goodbye!
